alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 23 at 11:03AM MST until February 24 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, ground blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon MST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Significant reductions in visibility, slippery roads, and partial to full lane blockages possible Friday afternoon through late Saturday afternoon due to blowing and drifting of existing snow cover. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread impacts from blowing and drifting snow possible Friday afternoon through late Saturday afternoon. Potential impacts include road closures due to snow drifts blocking traffic and whiteout conditions at times.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
